use_cases.headline: ## How Product Teams Use Strategy Board

cases.title: ### Product-Market Fit Discovery
cases.subtitle: *From hypothesis to validated opportunity*
cases.description: A B2B SaaS startup uses Strategy Board to test five different market segments. They create an objective ("Achieve product-market fit in Q2"), add five opportunities (one per segment), design solutions for each, and run experiments to validate demand.
cases.outcome: Three months later, they've invalidated three segments, doubled down on two, and have quantitative data showing where to focus.

cases.title: ### Growth Strategy Execution
cases.subtitle: *Breaking down a revenue goal into testable initiatives*
cases.description: An e-commerce company sets an objective: "Increase revenue by 30% in 12 months." They identify opportunities (cart abandonment, first-time buyer conversion, repeat purchase rate), propose solutions for each, and systematically test them.
cases.outcome: By connecting every growth experiment back to the revenue objective, the executive team sees exactly which bets are paying off‚Äîand reallocates budget accordingly.

cases.title: ### Platform Strategy Planning
cases.subtitle: *Coordinating strategy across multiple product teams*
cases.description: An enterprise platform with 7 product teams uses Strategy Board to align efforts. Each team contributes opportunities and solutions that ladder up to 3 company-wide objectives. Leadership uses themes to organize by strategic pillar.
cases.outcome: Everyone sees how their work contributes. No duplicated efforts. Clear understanding of strategic priorities.

questions.question: ### How is this different from a roadmap tool?
questions.answer: Strategy Board focuses on the 'why' and 'what if'‚Äîyour roadmap handles the 'when' and 'how.' Strategy Board helps you decide what belongs on your roadmap by validating strategic bets through experiments. They integrate seamlessly.

questions.question: ### Do I need to use all four levels?
questions.answer: No. Start with objectives and opportunities, or jump straight to experiments. The hierarchy is flexible‚Äîuse what makes sense for your maturity stage.

questions.question: ### How does scoring actually work?
questions.answer: RICE scoring for solutions: (Reach √ó Impact √ó Confidence) √∑ Effort. Opportunity scoring: Spread √ó Intensity √ó Value. Both auto-calculate as you input estimates. You can customize weights and formulas for your context.

questions.question: ### Can multiple teams share one Strategy Board?
questions.answer: Absolutely. Filter by team, owner, or theme. Each team sees their view while leadership sees the full picture.

questions.question: ### What if we already have a strategic framework (OKRs, etc)?
questions.answer: Strategy Board complements any framework. Map your OKRs as objectives, key results as opportunities, or create your own structure. It's flexible.

questions.question: ### How long does setup take?
questions.answer: Most teams start with 3-5 objectives in their first session (under an hour). You can import existing strategy or start fresh. The tool guides you through the framework.
